title: Sources: Torn ACL ends USC star Watkins' season
content: USC star JuJu Watkins will miss the remainder of the women's NCAA tournament after suffering a season-ending ACL tear during the Trojans' second-round game Monday night.

title: Ward to Titans GM at pro day: 'Solidifying' top pick
content: Quarterback Cam Ward believes he solidified himself as the top pick in the 2025 NFL draft after throwing at Miami's pro day Monday.

title: Luka: It's on 'me and Bron' to recharge Lakers
content: The struggles continued for Los Angeles on Monday, as Luka Doncic and the Lakers dropped a 118-106 decision to the Orlando Magic, a seventh loss in the past 10 games for a club that has just 11 games remaining to get back in a rhythm before the playoffs.

title: Celtics star Tatum exits with left ankle sprain
content: Celtics star Jayson Tatum left Monday's game late in the third quarter with a left ankle sprain after taking a hard foul. He told ESPN's Ramona Shelburne his ankle was "just sore" but that the team would be cautious.

title: UConn's Bueckers stars in 'amazing' Storrs finale
content: UConn's Paige Bueckers, a three-time All-American and the presumptive No. 1 overall pick in next month's WNBA draft, played in her final home game Monday night, a 91-57 victory over South Dakota State that pushed the Huskies into the NCAA's Sweet 16.

title: Terps 'never gave up,' seal Sweet 16 bid in 2OT
content: Sarah Te-Biasu made a tying 3-pointer in the fourth quarter, then scored eight of her 26 points in the second overtime to help fourth-seeded Maryland outlast fifth-seeded Alabama 111-108 on Monday to advance to the Sweet 16 of the women's NCAA tournament.

title: AD: 'No doubt' about return to help hobbled Mavs
content: Anthony Davis had 2 points, 6 rebounds, 3 assists, a steal and a block in 26 minutes in his return, a blowout victory over the Nets.

title: UNLV finalizing deal to hire Pastner, sources say
content: UNLV is finalizing what is expected to be a five-year deal to hire Georgia Tech's Josh Pastner as the school's next men's basketball coach.

title: Retirement plan: Rams' Nacua aims to quit at 30
content: Rams wide receiver Puka Nacua wants to retire at 30. The 23-year-old said he'd like to follow a path similar to that of future Hall of Famer Aaron Donald, who retired at 33 after 10 years in the NFL.

title: Why the NBA could be headed for 'worst tanking stretch we've ever seen'
content: Teams are getting really good at tanking. Can the NBA do anything more to stop it? Here's what's next for the race to the bottom.

content: Which NFL teams improved this offseason, and which took a step back? Our panel of experts ranked them from 1 to 32.

title: Loss to Canada closes out miserable window for Mauricio Pochettino's USMNT
content: The USMNT defense looked helpless in Sunday's Concacaf Nations League defeat to Canada. And has Christian Pulisic run out of gas?

title: Tuchel: Subbed Bellingham over fear of red card
content: England's Thomas Tuchel said he substituted Jude Bellingham during the 3-0 win against Latvia to prevent the midfielder from being sent off.

title: Alajuelense blasts Concacaf for backing León
content: Costa Rican team Liga Deportiva Alajuelense condemned Concacaf president Victor Montagliani after he expressed his full support for Club León in their legal fight against FIFA for being removed from the 2025 Club World Cup.

title: Source: Chelsea can return Sancho for $6.5m
content: Chelsea will have to pay Manchester United a fee of £5 million if they back out of the deal to sign Jadon Sancho permanently this summer, a source has told ESPN.

title: Yamal hits back at Van der Vaart after Spain win
content: Lamine Yamal has quipped back at Rafael van der Vaart's "pants down" jibe after helping Spain beat Netherlands in Sunday's UEFA Nations League quarterfinal.

title: Boehly: Chelsea owners could split over stadium
content: Todd Boehly has suggested the consortium group which owns Chelsea could split if an agreement on the situation surrounding Stamford Bridge isn't reached.

title: Brazil's Dorival, Ancelotti discuss Endrick progress
content: Brazil coach Dorival Júnior has revealed he has had a long talk with Real Madrid coach Carlo Ancelotti regarding Endrick's progress.

title: Gotham sign Geyse on loan from Man United

title: MLS: Charlotte sneaking up on league's best
content: Vancouver isn't the only surprise contender in 2025 as Charlotte is turning heads in our MLS Power Rankings.

content: George Foreman was a champion, but for a lot of nonboxing fans, he will be remembered for so much more.

content: After a month in which Juventus crashed out of the Champions League and the Coppa Italia, they finally parted ways with manager Thiago Motta. Here's why they did it and what else the club needs to fix.

title: Erode history-sheeter murder: One more surrenders in court, five arrested

title: Actor, karate instructor Shihan Hussaini no more
content: The 65-year-old karate expert and archer founded The Archery Association of Tamil Nadu (TAAT) and also served as its general secretary for several years

title: Groundwater level dipped in Afzalpur, Aland, Chincholi, but rose in Kamalapur taluk in Kalaburagi district
content: According to the data provided by the Ground Water Directorate, Aland taluk recorded an alarmingly dip in water level from 15.98 mbgl in 2014 to 29.48 mbgl in 2024

content: Victim was assaulted over his comment on Facebook post regarding a college festival video uploaded by another student, according to FIR

title: BJP-Sena alliance in 2014 broke due to dispute over four Assembly seats: Fadnavis

content: The district administration, the ZP, Tourism Department and Vinyog Ventures Private Limited have launched the service in Lumbini Garden

content: India’s current import dependence when it comes to crude oil, which includes supply from Venezuela, means Mr. Trump’s latest plans will add to the country’s tariff burden

title: Three children feared drown in U.P.'s Shahjahanpur
content: Police arrived at the scene with a flood unit and trained divers, but the children have not been found yet.

title: Rail traffic restored at accident site of bullet train project in Gujarat
content: After the segmental launching gantry was lifted, the first train passed on the rail line at 5.36 am on Tuesday, March 25, an official from the Western Railway's Ahmedabad division said.

title: Acer India announces one day menstrual leave per month
content: Acer India has introduced a menstrual leave policy that would give female employees one additional day of paid leave per month

title: Cauvery Aarti is fine, but Bengaluru needs action beyond symbolism to quench its thirst

title: The need for a localised urban agenda | Explained
content: Can centrally sponsored schemes and centrally run urban missions give localised solution to cities? Does the central control over finances bode well for the growth of cities? Can a top-down approach work? Is decentralisation of funds necessary?

content: Fire damages eight houses in Baramullah town, Jammu and Kashmir, cause unknown, one injured, property loss in crores

title: As ice frozen for millennia thaws, Kashmir wakes up to new risks
content: A new study has found thawing permafrost could affect 193 km of roads, 2,415 households, 903 alpine lakes, and eight hydropower projects in the Kashmir Himalaya

title: Centre issues guidelines to tackle high rate of deletions of MGNREGS job-cards
content: In a guideline recently circulated to the States, the government wants the job-cards intended for deletions to be verified by the gram sabha and the workers be made aware of the appeal process

content: An amount of ₹46.79 crore allocated for road repairs, ₹10.28 crore for repair of buildings under the Kozhikode Corporation.

title: Concerted efforts being made to make NTR district TB-free: official
content: Awareness rally held from the Old Government General Hospital to mark World Tuberculosis Day; 6,404 people in the district received treatment for TB last year, says District TB Prevention Officer

title: Explore taking up Polavaram-Banakacherla linkage project in operation model, suggests naidu
content: Detailed Project Report for the linkage should be completed by June 20, and the project should receive Central Water Commission approval by October 20, CM directs officials

title: Maharashtra government seeks Kunal Kamra’s apology for his joke on Shinde

title: Teachers’ association, educationists urge Karnataka govt. to continue guest teachers’ service till April-end
content: As per the rules, the guest teachers’ service will end by March 31, 2025. However, the academic year 2024-25 will end on April 10, 2025, and schools will declare summer vacation. After that, other processes, including school enrollment, will continue.

title: "Supari" For Comedy? Conspiracy Probe After Kunal Kamra Mocks Eknath Shinde
content: Mumbai Police are investigating if Kunal Kamra's jokes targeting Shiv Sena chief Eknath Shinde were part of a conspiracy and whether the comic received money or any other form of help to mock the Maharashtra Chief Minister, sources have said.

title: Canada Cites "India's Growing Global Influence" In Allegation Against Pak
content: Canadian Security Intelligence Service (CSIS) said Pakistan could conduct foreign interference activities against Canada.

title: "Don't Support, But...": E Shinde's Newton's Law Take On Sena Vandalism
content: Shiv Sena leader and Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has said he does not support party workers' vandalism at a Mumbai studio to protest comedian Kunal Kamra's remarks but quoted Issac Newton's third law of motion

title: 2 Weeks After Wedding, UP Woman, Lover Hire Killer To Murder Husband
content: Upon investigation, it was revealed that as the victim's wife and her lover were unable to meet after her marriage, they decided to kill the husband.

title: Trump Official Mistakenly Adds Journalist To Group Chat On Yemen War Plan
content: A US journalist was inadvertently included in a group chat in which Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, Vice President JD Vance and other top American officials discussed upcoming strikes against Yemen's Huthi rebels, the White House confirmed Monday.

title: How Trump's New Social Media Policy May Impact Indian Green Card Holders
content: Green card holders living in America may soon be required to surrender their social media accounts to the government under a new proposal by President Donald Trump administration's as part of their crackdown on immigration.

title: Woman Spikes Husband's Food, Kills Him With Mother's Help In Bengaluru: Cops
content: A 37-year-old real-estate businessman was allegedly murdered by his wife and mother-in-law over his alleged multiple extramarital affairs and illegal business dealings in Bengaluru last week, police said on Monday.

title: "Come To Tamil Nadu...": Kunal Kamra To Shiv Sena Supporter In Viral Call
content: As Kunal Kamra battles a fresh controversy over his comments against Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, a recording of a purported phone call by a Shiv Sena supporter threatening the stand-up comedian has gone viral.

content: Due to the Trump Administration's massive crackdown on immigrants - both illegal and legal - key immigration agencies of the US have enhanced scrutiny of those travelling abroad and even more greatly heightened checks for those returning to the US.

content: ₹30 crore allocated to develop and link important roads in the city; a sum of ₹20 crore earmarked to complete construction of houses for all applicants under the ‘Kochi Without Homeless’ project

title: RSS wants to destroy India’s education system, Rahul tells student leaders
content: The Narendra Modi government’s model is to hand over all resources to Adani and Ambani and hand over institutions to the RSS, the Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi said

content: He emphasizes that the people of Bihar are very intelligent and hard working and they have an important role in the development of other States and big cities of the country.

content: Telangana High Court directs Centre, A.P., and Telangana to allow IPS officer Abhishek Mohanty to serve in Telangana till CAT adjudicates his plea

title: Nagpur authorities raze homes of violence accused, HC halts further demolition
content: The Municipal Corporation officials demolished the two-storey residence of Fahim Khan and a balcony of the residence of Yusuf Sheikh. Terming the action ‘high-handedness’, the Nagpur Bench of the Bombay High Court questions why the owners were not issued a notice that the construction was illegal. “Is the NMC targeting the petitioners based on their religion?” it asks.

title: US Gold Card Scheme A Hit? Trump's Top Official Says "1,000 Sold In A Day"
content: Donald Trump's 'Gold Card' or 'Golden Visa' scheme, which offers permanent residency and optional citizenship of the United States for $5 million, per card, seems to have become a hit, if US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick's claim is indeed true.

title: Assembly defers passing Private Universities Bill
content: Discussion on Bill lasted over two hours. Postponement attributed to time constraints as House could not conclude the proceedings by the scheduled time of 6 p.m.

content: State to devise a comprehensive enforcement, social awareness, prevention and de-addiction strategy after the police identify narcotic drug abuse, chiefly the abuse of “wakefulness drugs” from the meth family, as a driver of recent violent crimes

content: Among one crore consumers in Bescom jurisdiction, around 3 lakh (around 2%) are estimated to get smart meters, said officials

content: ‘Revenue from fees and user charges has increased from ₹38 cr. to ₹55 cr., making life in the city more expensive, say UDF councillors

title: No sanctioned Tamil teachers in Kendriya Vidyalayas, only 24 part-time teachers, Union Minister informs Lok Sabha
content: Kendriya Vidyalayas are mandated to have a uniform scheme of education. Therefore, the sanctioned posts of language teachers are those of Hindi, English, and Sanskrit. However, there is a  provision for teaching of other languages for the willing students, Minister of State for Education Jayant Chaudhary

title: NWLS: Kansas City Current star Temwa Chawinga looking unstoppable
content: our writers studied the action from across Matchday 2 to come up with this week's order of all 14 teams in the league . this week, we've compiled a list of the best teams in matchday 2 . the team climbed into the lead in just the second minute and never looked back .

title: Jimmy Butler's Miami coffee shop posts special prices -- for Warriors employees
content: former Miami Heat forward's first brick-and-mortar location for his coffee brand, "Big Face Coffee" opened in December in the city's design district . prices typically range from $4 to $10 for drinks, according to a post of the menu on Yelp .

title: March Madness Day 4: Updates, analysis as women's Sweet 16 is set
content: the women's Sweet 16 is set! Texas Longhorns and the USC Trojans rolled in their Round of 32 matchup . the win was far overshadowed by the injury of player of the year favorite JuJu Watkins .

title: There's a new No. 1 in the women's Sweet 16 rerankings
content: uConn beat south Dakota State in the 2025 women's NCAA tournament . a torn ACL in her right knee is a season-ending injury . americans haven't reached the regionals, but there is plenty of movement in the rankings .

title: The best girls' teams in 2024-25
content: the third consecutive championship for the team ends the high school careers of McDonald's All-Americans Grace Knox (LSU) and Aliyahna "Puff" Morris (Cal) Sienna Betts took Grandview (CO) all the way to the state championship for a third career 6A title .

title: Road to the men's Frozen Four: Complete schedule, teams at a glance
content: the 2025 men's hockey tournament is set, with the 16-team bracket in place . all games will air on the ESPN networks and stream on ESPN+ . the winners of the six conference tournaments win automatic NCAA berths .

title: Stunning scissor kick wins People's Puskas award for best amateur goal
content: the eight nominees for the "People's Puskas" award are revealed . the award is given to the player considered to have scored the "most beautiful" goal of the year . since its inaugural year in 2009, 37.5% of the winning goals have been bicycle kicks .

title: From Cooper Flagg to Derik Queen: Montverde Academy impacting men's NCAA tournament
content: a 3-pointer puts Colorado State ahead with six seconds left . this time last year, Montverde (Florida) Academy was sitting atop the ESPN SCNext top 25 high school basketball rankings . former coach Kevin Boyle recently took over as head coach at SPIRE Academy in Ohio .

title: All 35 members of Vijayapura Municipal Corporation disqualified for not declaring assets
content: health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: The best boys' teams in 2024-25
content: five-star Kansas commit Darryn Peterson led the crew with 23 points on 9-of-16 shooting in a dominant 77-50 win over Fort Erie International Academy (Canada) the lone newcomer in the rankings this week is Fishers (IN), which has been 30-0 overall this season and is currently riding a 43-game winning streak dating back to last year .

title: Dowry, domestic abuse: Woman strangled by husband in UK, kin fight for justice
content: Harshita Brella, a 24-year-old Delhi resident, was murdered in the UK by her husband, Pankaj Lamba, after enduring severe domestic abuse. Despite her family's pleas, Harshita couldn't return to India due to legal constraints. Her family seeks justice, emphasizing her husband's premeditated intentions and dowry-related threats.

title: 'Action causes reaction': Shinde on vandalism by Sena workers over Kunal Kamra's joke
content: Maharashtra deputy CM Eknath Shinde criticized comedian Kunal Kamra's joke calling him a 'gaddar,' stating there should be limits on freedom of speech. The controversy led to vandalism by Shiv Sena workers, legal actions, and political debates, with Kamra refusing to apologize.

title: 'Grenades, sleeping bags recovered': Security forces comb J&K Kathua for terrorists
content: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district found weapons, grenades, and supplies while searching for terrorists hiding in the forested area. On the operation's third day, troops engaged in gunfire after detecting suspicious movement. The Special Operations Group acted on intelligence about terrorists hiding in a local nursery. The area remains under tight security.

title: Shark Tank’s Anupam Mittal on IPL 2025: May be time to replace bowlers with…
content: Anupam Mittal, Shark Tank India judge, commented on the IPL 2025 season, suggesting that it heavily favors batsmen with high scores dominating games. He humorously proposed replacing bowlers with machines. The 18th edition of IPL began on March 22 and features 74 matches. Mittal also discussed leveraging India's UPI to challenge global payment giants like Visa and Mastercard.

title: Leaked war chat: Full list of participants in 'Houthi PC small group'
content: In a stunning breach of protocol, senior members of the Trump administration planned and executed a military strike on Yemen through a Signal group chat that accidentally included a journalist. The encrypted thread, titled “Houthi PC small group,” brought together some of the most powerful figures in US national security—alongside The Atlantic’s editor in chief, Jeffrey Goldberg, who was mistakenly added to the conversation. Over several days, officials casually discussed war plans, debated timing, and celebrated the eventual airstrikes—all on a platform not authorized for classified communications.

title: New process to retrieve unclaimed bank deposits soon
content: Banks in India are set to introduce a new format to help recover unclaimed deposits worth over ₹78,213 crore. The new guidelines will require banks to display unclaimed deposit details online and streamline the reclaim process, making it fully operational by FY26.

title: WATCH: What LSG owner said in the dressing room after DC loss
content: Ashutosh Sharma's unbeaten 66 led Delhi Capitals to a thrilling one-wicket win over Lucknow Super Giants in the IPL, chasing a target of 210. Despite early setbacks, Sharma's partnership with debutant Vipraj Nigam and the final overs' dramatic finish secured victory. LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka urged the squad to focus on the positives despite the narrow loss.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk: 'No more loans to...' as DOGE fights loan fraud
content: Elon Musk supports the new SBA policy to prevent fraud involving stolen Social Security numbers, requiring applicants’ date of birth for direct loans. Measures include halting loans for those under 18 or over 120 years old, addressing past fraudulent cases and improving data integrity in federal loan programs.

title: 'Gaddar' joke row: Kangana Ranaut's '2 minutes of fame' jibe at Kunal Kamra
content: BJP MP Kangana Ranaut condemned Kunal Kamra’s parody targeting Maharashtra deputy CM Eknath Shinde, calling it disrespectful. The controversial act by Kamra led to vandalism by Shinde’s supporters, political confrontations, and legal actions against Kamra, with divergent reactions from political leaders Devendra Fadnavis and Uddhav Thackeray.

title: 'Dhokhebaaz' poster targeting Nitish over Waqf bill appears outside Rabri's home
content: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar is under criticism from Muslim groups for his support of the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024, and alleged neglect of the community's interests. The poster emerges amidst a video controversy where Kumar was seen making gestures during the national anthem.

title: Zerodha's Nithin Kamath: This is closest thing we have seen to a Miracle Drug
content: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath highlighted the transformative potential of weight-loss drugs Ozempic and Mounjaro, which help in losing 15-20% body weight and provide other health benefits. He also noted that these drugs could reduce addictive behaviors and impact various industries. Despite their high cost and need for more research, Kamath called them a potential 'miracle drug.'

title: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch
content: the Rebels remain in the top spot after a strong performance on the road against Alabama, going 2-1 in Tuscaloosa . UC Irvine is the highest-ranked newcomer at no. 19, followed by no. 23 Arizona, which has bounced in and out of the rankings a bit this year .

title: First bets for the men's Sweet 16
content: the Sweet 16 is set in the men's NCAA tournament . there are no true Cinderellas left but there are plenty of compelling matchups . the best bets are accurate as of publication time . despite the best defense in the country, their offense is what should make the difference .

title: Trump officials 'accidentally' sent war plans to journalist: What was in the texts
content: Journalist Jeffrey Goldberg accidentally received classified war plans via a Signal group chat that included top Trump administration officials. The plans detailed the timing and targets of the recent US strikes against Yemen's Houthi rebels.

title: 'Told me about 36 hrs duty': Psychiatrist claims RG Kar victim suffered acute stress
content: A psychiatrist claims the RG Kar Hospital rape-murder victim consulted him for mental distress a month before her death, revealing severe work pressure and hospital irregularities. The victim had exposed issues in the procurement of medicines, leading to victimisation. The primary suspect, Sanjay Roy, received a life sentence, while the CBI continues its investigation.

title: Man lost 19 kilos in 3 months without gym, shares diet and fitness routine
content: In 2025, Samvit Mishra successfully lost 19 kg in three months by focusing on sustainable lifestyle changes, including a balanced diet of natural foods and maintaining an active routine of stair climbing and cycling. Despite initial cravings, he made healthier food choices without relying on crash diets or gym memberships.

title: Woman elopes, her kin hire JCB to raze homes of lover’s family in Gujarat
content: In Bharuch district, Gujarat, portions of six houses in Kareli village were demolished by the family of a married woman after she eloped with a divorced man from the village. The woman's family took this action when the man's family could not produce him. Police arrested six people, including the bulldozer driver.

title: Eden Gardens pitch invader reveals what Virat Kohli told him
content: An 18-year-old high school student, Rituparno Pakhira, was taken into police custody and handed a ban from Eden Gardens for the IPL season after invading the pitch to touch his idol, Virat Kohli's feet. Kohli embraced him and urged security not to harm him.

title: Sensex rises over 650 points; Nifty50 above 23,800
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, continued to rally for the 7th straight session on Tuesday. While BSE Sensex surged over 650 points, Nifty50 went above 23,800.

title: Mumbai cops issue summons to Kunal Kamra over 'traitor' joke on Shinde
content: The Khar Police summoned comedian Kunal Kamra for allegedly making derogatory remarks about Deputy CM Eknath Shinde during a stand-up show. Shiv Sena members vandalized the studio in response, leading to arrests. Investigations are ongoing with two FIRs registered against Kamra and the vandals.

title: Aamir Khan rejected 'Dangal' thinking Shah Rukh, Salman sent Nitesh to end his career
content: Aamir Khan’s 2016 release 'Dangal' remains one of Indian cinema’s most successful films, both critically and commercially. Based on the life of Mahavir Singh Phogat and his daughters, the sports drama captivated audiences across the globe. However, in a recent conversation, Aamir revealed that he was initially reluctant to take on the project and even thought Salman Khan and Shah Rukh Khan might have sent the director to him with the script to end his career.

title: 'Illegal': India rejects Pakistan's 'repeated references' to J&K at UN
content: India has firmly dismissed Pakistan's repeated claims on Jammu and Kashmir at the United Nations, reiterating that J&K is an integral part of India. India criticized Pakistan for its divisive agenda and called for Pakistan to vacate the illegally occupied region. The Indian representative emphasized that India's stance remains unchanged despite Pakistan's continuous attempts to mislead the international forum.

title: 'Has intent to interfere': Canada alleges India could meddle in elections
content: Canada has accused India of intent and capability to interfere in its upcoming general election. The Canadian Security Intelligence Service (CSIS) cited concerns over potential interference, alongside China, Russia, and Pakistan. Relations with India worsened after the expulsion of Indian diplomats over alleged involvement in plots against Sikh separatists.

title: Why BJP-Shiv Sena alliance talks fell apart in 2014? Fadnavis reveals backstory
content: Maharashtra chief minister Devendra Fadnavis explained the split between BJP and Shiv Sena in the 2014 state assembly elections was due to seat-sharing disagreements and Shiv Sena's refusal to accept the proposed arrangement. Despite separate contests, they eventually joined forces post-election, with BJP leading the government and Shiv Sena as a key ally.

title: Watch: Mumbai's Dharavi shaken as 20+ LPG cylinders on truck explode
content: Several explosions occurred due to a fire in a truck carrying LPG cylinders near the Dharavi bus depot in Mumbai. Over 20 gas cylinders exploded, lighting up the night sky and damaging nearby vehicles. Fortunately, no injuries were reported, though the incident caused significant concern among residents.

title: 'Shocks our conscience': Supreme Court pulls up Uttar Pradesh on demolitions
content: Supreme Court criticized the Uttar Pradesh government's swift demolition of houses in Prayagraj, deeming it "shocking" and hinting at allowing owners to rebuild, pending the case's outcome. The demolitions targeted homes of a lawyer, professor, and others within 24 hours of notice. The state defended its actions, but the court noted procedural violations and insufficient response time.

title: Trump to impose tariffs on nations buying Venezuelan oil. Will it impact India?
content: US President Donald Trump announced 25% tariffs on imports from countries purchasing Venezuelan oil and gas, potentially affecting India, China, and others. These tariffs aim to exert economic pressure on Venezuela, which Trump accuses of hostility and other malpractices. The tariffs, effective from April 2, coincide with his broader plan for reciprocal tariffs on other nations.

title: Vandalism, FIR, demolition, warning: Kunal Kamra read riot act
content: Kunal Kamra's recent stand-up show has led to significant controversy, with an FIR filed against him and a hotel shed demolished by BMC. Kamra's derogatory remarks about Maharashtra Deputy CM Eknath Shinde have provoked strong reactions, including vandalism and legal action against involved parties.

title: Columbia student, in US since childhood, sues Trump admin to stop deportation
content: Yunseo Chung, a 21-year-old Columbia University student, is suing the Trump administration after ICE attempted to deport her despite her lawful resident status. Chung claims this is part of a broader effort to suppress pro-Palestinian activism among university students.

title: ‘Amitabh will always be mine', Jaya told Rekha, reveals Hanif Zaveri
content: The alleged love triangle between Amitabh Bachchan, Jaya Bachchan, and Rekha remains one of Bollywood’s most talked-about controversies. In a recent conversation on the Meri Saheli podcast, veteran author and film historian Hanif Zaveri shared intriguing insights into how Rekha entered Amitabh’s life, Jaya’s unwavering stand, and the eventual fallout.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for March 25
content: Stock market recommendations: RBL Bank and ACC are recommended stocks to buy today by Somil Mehta of Mirae Asset Sharekhan. RBL Bank is anticipated to retrace to Rs 205, while ACC is expected to rebound to Rs 2185.

title: Former UFC veteran announces retirement in discussion with Trump
content: Henry Cejudo, a former UFC veteran, announced his retirement following three consecutive losses. He suffered eye injuries in his latest defeat, narrowly avoiding permanent damage. Speaking with US President Donald Trump, Cejudo revealed he has one more fight before leaving the Octagon for good. Despite recent setbacks, he had a successful career, winning and defending multiple titles.

title: 'High-handed', fumes HC as Nagpur riot accused's home razed before court stay
content: Municipal bulldozers in Nagpur demolished properties linked to riot suspects, including alleged mastermind Fahim Khan, under heavy police security. The Bombay high court later halted further demolitions, criticizing the action as high-handed. Authorities cited planning violations and plan to continue targeting unauthorized constructions linked to those accused of the violence, which left one dead and over 40 injured.

title: Mob in janitor uniform storms Chennai YouTuber's home, dumps human excreta
content: A group dressed as sanitation workers launched an attack on YouTuber Savukku Shankar's Chennai home, dumping waste and threatening his mother. The incident appears to be revenge for Shankar's alleged remarks about sanitation workers, prompting widespread condemnation and demands for justice from the Tamil Nadu government.

title: MPs to earn Rs 1.2 lakh/month as Centre notifies 24% hike in pay & pension
content: The government has announced a 24% salary increase for MPs to Rs 1.24 lakh per month starting April 1, 2023. Daily allowances, pensions, and constituency allowances have also been raised. Congress MP Harish Meena questioned the net gain due to tax implications, while other MPs welcomed the hike but called for increased MPLADS funds.

title: Wayne Gretzky’s legacy honored with iconic Goal Lamp at North Pole
content: Wayne Gretzky, the legendary hockey player, had his nameplate added to a 20-foot goal lamp celebrating Team Canada during the 2016 World Pond Hockey Championships. The lamp traveled across Canada, honoring the country's passion for hockey, and eventually reached the North Pole.

title: How heart attack chest pain differs from gastric chest pain?
content: Chest pain can be alarming, with the potential confusion between a heart attack and gastric pain. Heart attack pain feels like heavy pressure and may spread to other areas, while gastric pain is sharp and burning. If experiencing severe or persistent chest pain with additional symptoms, seek immediate medical attention for safety.

title: 'Jana Nayagan': Veteran actor reunites with Thalapathy Vijay after 25 yrs
content: Vijay's final film before entering politics, 'Jana Nayagan,' is progressing swiftly, with an expected release by end of this year or early next. It features stars like Pooja Hegde and Shruti Haasan. Veteran actor Nizhalgal Ravi reunites with Vijay after 25 years, adding nostalgia and excitement among fans.

title: 'A traitor is a traitor': Uddhav Thackeray backs comic Kunal Kamra
content: Uddhav Thackeray has defended comedian Kunal Kamra for calling deputy chief minister Eknath Shinde a 'traitor,' stating Kamra expressed public sentiment. Thackeray criticized the attack on Kamra's studio, urging the government to compensate him, similar to compensation given for the Nagpur riots.

title: Talks to start tomorrow to clinch first part of US trade deal by Sept-Oct
content: Indian and US officials will get down to finalising the contours of the proposed bilateral trade agreement, starting Wednesday, along with terms of reference and schedule of what is expected to be a two-stage pact. Assistant US trade representative for South and Central Asia Brendan Lynch will hold talks with Rajesh Agarwal, additional secretary in the commerce department, with the idea of clinching the first tranche of the deal by Sept-Oct.

title: IPL: Incredible Ashutosh snatches win for DC from the jaws of defeat
content: Ashutosh Sharma led Delhi Capitals to a thrilling last-over victory against Lucknow Super Giants, smashing an unbeaten 66 off 31 balls at the IPL 2025 opener. Despite a shaky start and a daunting target of 210, Sharma's composed and aggressive batting ensured a stunning one-wicket win. The young batter roared in celebration, swinging his bat and gesturing animatedly toward the Delhi Capitals dugout after sealing a breathtaking chase.

title: 'Diplomat' box office collection day 11
content: John Abraham's film 'Diplomat', which released on March 14, has gained momentum in its second week due to positive word of mouth. Based on a true event, the movie's total collection stands at Rs 26.55 crore by the end of the second Monday, despite a significant drop in earnings on that day.

title: Greenland sees red as Trump sends Usha to ad-Vance US interests
content: Red flags are raised as US deploys Indian-American Second Lady Usha Vance to Greenland, sparking tensions with Denmark. While the official visit aims to celebrate US-Greenland ties, concerns grow over US intentions. Vice President JD Vance's remarks further fuel the controversy, with Europeans protesting the aggressive move.

title: Supreme Court: Bail conditions not flouted, Teni Jr can go home for Ram Navami
content: The Supreme Court rejected claims that Ashish Mishra broke bail conditions and allowed him to visit his hometown for Ram Navami. The court found the accusations of attending a forbidden function and influencing witnesses to be false, permitting his visit under specific conditions.

title: Who's the next SMU? College football teams poised to rise in 2025
content: college football reporters give their thoughts on teams and players that could help their teams rise next season . the Tigers face five other teams in ESPN's Way-too-Early Top 25 rankings ( Florida , Ole Miss , South Carolina , Texas A&M , Alabama ).

content: fantasy baseball managers in leagues with daily transactions will lock at the scheduled start time of each player's game on any given day . if you have not yet drafted, keep in mind that players will be locked in the roster spots you select them with . all Cubs and Dodgers from the Tokyo Series will still be able to start, sit, IL, add and/or drop Cubs .
